00032 /*
00033  * VMIC registers.
00034  */
00035 #define VMIC_PORT12 0x12
00036 #define VMIC_PORT34 0x10
00037 #define VMIC_PORT56 0x16
00038 #define VMIC_PORT78 0x14
00039 #define VMIC_CSRU   0x20
00040 #define VMIC_CSRL   0x21
00041 
00042 /* 
00043  * VMIC outputs
00044  */ 
00045 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_1      0x00004000
00046 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_2      0x00000800
00047 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_3      0x00000100
00048 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_4      0x00000030
00049 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_5      0x00000004
00050 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_6      0x00800000
00051 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_7      0x00100000
00052 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_8      0x00020000
00053 
00054 /*
00055  * ...and their aliases for muCap:
00056  */
00057 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_EW1          VMIC_OUTPUT_1
00058 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_EW2          VMIC_OUTPUT_2
00059 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_LATCH_RESET  VMIC_OUTPUT_3
00060 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_CAENandCOMP  VMIC_OUTPUT_4
00061 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_CRATE4       VMIC_OUTPUT_5
00062 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_SOFTSTOP     VMIC_OUTPUT_6
00063 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_CLOCK_RESET  VMIC_OUTPUT_7
00064 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_START1       (VMIC_OUTPUT_1 | VMIC_OUTPUT_4)
00065 #define VMIC_OUTPUT_START2       (VMIC_OUTPUT_2 | VMIC_OUTPUT_4)
00066 
00067 /*
00068  * VMIC input channels.
00069  */
00070 #define VMIC_INPUT_END_EVENT    62
00071 #define VMIC_INPUT_BLOCK        59
00072

00074  *
00075  */
00076 static WORD vmic_vme_base;
00077 static struct vme_handle *vmic_handle;
00078 static WORD vmic_current_low;
00079 static WORD vmic_current_high;
00080 
00081 static BOOL vmic_enabled;
00082 
00083 static BOOL not_really_started;

00085 extern INT cycle_ram();

00087 /*
00088  *
00089  */
00090 void vmic_set(DWORD new_value)
00091 {
00092   WORD low = new_value & 0xffff;
00093   WORD high = (new_value >> 16) & 0xffff;
00094 
00095   if(low != vmic_current_low) { 
00096     vme_write_d16(vmic_handle, vmic_vme_base | VMIC_PORT12, low);
00097     vmic_current_low = low;
00098   }
00099  
00100   if(high != vmic_current_high) { 
00101     vme_write_d16(vmic_handle, vmic_vme_base | VMIC_PORT34, high);
00102     vmic_current_high = high;
00103   }
00104 }
00105 
00106 /*
00107  *
00108  */
00109 void vmic_turn_on(DWORD new_channels)
00110 {
00111   WORD low = vmic_current_low | (new_channels & 0xffff);
00112   WORD high = vmic_current_high | ((new_channels >> 16) & 0xffff);
00113   vmic_set((high << 16) | low);
00114 }
00115 
00116 INT vmic_read_input(int channel)
00117 {
00118   short status, mask;
00119   
00120   int reg;
00121  
00122   // decide which port and bit we're reading
00123   if ((channel >= 0) && (channel < 16)) {
00124     reg = VMIC_PORT56;
00125     mask = (1 << channel);
00126   } else if ((channel >= 16) && (channel < 32)) {
00127     reg = VMIC_PORT78;
00128     mask = (1 << (channel-16));
00129   } else if ((channel >= 32) && (channel < 48)) {
00130     reg = VMIC_PORT12;
00131     mask = (1 << (channel-32));
00132   } else if ((channel >= 48) && (channel < 64)) {
00133     reg = VMIC_PORT34;
00134     mask = (1 << (channel-48));
00135   }
00136 
00137   status = vme_read_d16(vmic_handle, vmic_vme_base | reg); 
00138  
00139   if ((status & mask)==0) {
00140     return 0;
00141   } else {
00142     return 1;
00143   }
00144 }
00145 
00146 /*
00147  * vmic_ttl_init
00148  *
00149  */
00150 INT vmic_ttl_init()
00151 {
00152   vmic_enabled = 
00153     (odb_find_key("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/VMIC", crate_number) != 0);
00154 
00155   if(!vmic_enabled) {
00156     return SUCCESS;
00157   }
00158 
00159   diag_print(4,"vmic_ttl_init()\n");
00160 
00161   vmic_vme_base = 
00162     odb_get_word("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/VMIC/vme address", crate_number);
00163 
00164   struct vme_mapping_ctrl mapping = {
00165           VMEMAP_DWIDTH_16,
00166           VMEMAP_ASPACE_A16,
00167           VMEMAP_SUPUSERAM_SUPER,
00168           VMEMAP_PRGDATAAM_DATA
00169   };
00170 
00171   vmic_handle = vme_open(vmic_vme_base, mapping, 0x100, 0);
00172   if(vmic_handle == NULL) {
00173     diag_print(0, "Unable to open handle for VMIC TTL I/O register\n");
00174     return FE_ERR_HW;
00175   }
00176 
00177   // Set control register: port 4 as input, all others as output
00178   int status = 
00179     vme_write_d16_checked(vmic_handle, vmic_vme_base | VMIC_CSRU, 0xefff);
00180   if(status != SUCCESS) {
00181     diag_print(0, "Unable to write CSRU value to VMIC TTL I/O register\n");
00182     return FE_ERR_HW;
00183   }
00184 
00185   // Wait a moment to allow this setting to take effect
00186   ss_sleep(400);
00187 
00188   // Turn off all outputs
00189 /*
00190   vme_write_d16(vmic_handle, vmic_vme_base | VMIC_PORT12, 0);
00191   vmic_current_high = 0;
00192   vme_write_d16(vmic_handle, vmic_vme_base | VMIC_PORT34, 0);
00193   vmic_current_low = 0;
00194 */
00195   vmic_set(0);
00196 
00197   not_really_started = 0;
00198 
00199   return SUCCESS;
00200 }
00201 
00202 /*
00203  * vmic_ttl_start_block
00204  *
00205  */
00206 INT vmic_ttl_start_block()
00207 {
00208   if(!vmic_enabled) {
00209     return SUCCESS;
00210   }
00211 
00212   diag_print(4,"vmic_ttl_start_block()\n");
00213 
00214   // Is crate 4 going to be part of the cycle?
00215   DWORD maybe_crate4 = 0;
00216   if(crate_is_participating(4)) {
00217     maybe_crate4 = VMIC_OUTPUT_CRATE4;
00218   } 
00219 
00220   // If there is already a block in progress, refuse to start another one.
00221   int block_input = vmic_read_input(VMIC_INPUT_BLOCK);
00222   if(block_input != 0) {
00223     diag_print(0, "BLOCK is high when it should be low!\n");
00224     vmic_set(0);
00225     ss_sleep(10);
00226     vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_LATCH_RESET);
00227     ss_sleep(10);
00228     vmic_set(0);
00229     ss_sleep(100);
00230     not_really_started = 1;
00231     return FE_ERR_HW; 
00232   }
00233 
00234   // First send a pulse on the latch reset line:
00235   vmic_set(0);
00236   vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_LATCH_RESET | maybe_crate4);
00237 //  vmic_set(0 | maybe_crate4);
00238 
00239 #if 1
00240   // Now check whether the reset was effective--did it make the EndEvent
00241   // signal clear?
00242   if(vmic_read_input(VMIC_INPUT_END_EVENT) != 0) {
00243     diag_print(0, "END_EVENT signal not clearing with reset\n");
00244     not_really_started = 1;
00245     return FE_ERR_HW;
00246   }
00247 #endif
00248 
00249 #if 0
00250   // Try another reset...going straight into the start of the cycle
00251   // so that the compressor timing matches the CAENs.
00252   vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_LATCH_RESET | maybe_crate4);
00253 #endif
00254 
00255   int ram = cycle_ram();
00256 
00257   diag_print(2, "Starting RAM %d cycle\n", ram);
00258 
00259   //
00260   // Finally, start the cycle.  
00261   // 
00262   if(ram == 1) {
00263     vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_START1 | maybe_crate4);
00264     vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_EW1 | maybe_crate4);
00265   } else {
00266     vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_START2 | maybe_crate4);
00267     vmic_set(VMIC_OUTPUT_EW2 | maybe_crate4);
00268   }
00269 
00270   // We don't currently have any way of testing that the cycle started 
00271   // correctly.  Perhaps something to think about adding...
00272   not_really_started = 0;
00273   return SUCCESS;
00274 }
00275 
00276 /*
00277  * vmic_ttl_stop_block
00278  *
00279  */
00280 INT vmic_ttl_stop_block()
00281 {
00282   if(!vmic_enabled) {
00283     return SUCCESS;
00284   }
00285 
00286   diag_print(4,"vmic_ttl_stop_block()\n");
00287 
00288   // set SOFTSTOP output
00289   vmic_turn_on(VMIC_OUTPUT_SOFTSTOP);
00290 }
00291 
00292 /*
00293  * vmic_ttl_poll_live()
00294  *
00295  * Called periodically while a block is active; performs active readout.
00296  *
00297  * Returns:
00298  * - ordinarily 0,
00299  * - a request for a "soft stop" end-of-block, or
00300  * - an error code
00301  */
00302 INT vmic_ttl_poll_live()
00303 {
00304   if(!vmic_enabled) {
00305     return SUCCESS;
00306   }
00307 
00308   //diag_print(4,"vmic_ttl_poll_live()\n");
00309 
00310   INT end_event = vmic_read_input(VMIC_INPUT_END_EVENT);
00311 
00312   if(end_event || not_really_started) {
00313     vmic_set(0); 
00314     return FE_END_BLOCK;
00315   } else {
00316     return SUCCESS;
00317   }
00318 }
